reviews.sentence: Great getaway. Had a great stay at the revamped hotel. This used to be the Sahara now newly the SLS. It is set up to appeal to the younger set all black and white and modern. They have done a nice job although I wish the casino was larger and they had more mid priced food options. Rooms are nice with large flat screen tvs and lots of mirrors. It is a fun place for a little trip.
Tiny Rooms. This was a nicely remodeled hotel but gez the rooms were tiny.

pleasantly surprised at the renovations of the old Sahara Hotel. i stayed here for a few nights and got a fabulous rate the hotel renovations can make you easily forget this used to be the Nascar themed Sahara hotel of a few years ago. the outdoor roller coaster is gone as is the Nascar buffet. all replaced with famous restaurants and a pool scene that draws in quite the crowdwe rented loungers on Friday at the main pool Foxtail. i was able to negotiate down to 100 minimum spend which goes pretty quick all cocktails are 18 and up beers are nt that much less. it was worth it to have a king sized mattress included. lounger polside with waitress service keep in mind when the bill comes they will try to hustle you for adl tips gratuity is already added to your bill PLUS an adl service charge. i m sure this tactic works with a bunch of dudes for a bachelor party. there are also poker tables polside and a live DJthe rooms are small but have their own flair to them i liked the designtip there s a walgrens around the block head there and stock up on liquor wine beer snacks etc. you will save alot. however you ca nt store in mini fridge it s on a sensor system so anything removed for more than 30 seconds you will be charged. stock up on the free icelocation is a bit more north on the strip than most people would want however there s a monorail stop outside the SLS which takes you much closer to the main strip.
City Center feel for a better deal. Great remodeling and awesome room. Bed was very comfortable and tons of cozy pillows. Great staff as well. we had definitely stay here again.

Despite being of an older demographic we had a great time. Stayed here for a week while attending an event. The hotel has a luxurious feel and they have done a good job updating an older location. The staff and housekeeping were excellent the rooms were clean and of good size and the sound proofing was great. We found the restaurants to be of a very high quality but not too expensive. The gaming area is smaller than other locations and you are located a little away from the center of the strip. there is a free shuttle every hour from the airport but a cab was only 20 for 4 of us. The clientele is young and trendy but the price keeps the rougher elements away.

I really want to be able to give this place a higher rating. This is the first less than stellar review I have written. I think our problems stemmed from inter departmental communication issues. We stayed in Room 31545 for 3 nights. First off the remodel from the old Sahara looks really good. The lobby casino and pool area all look great. The rooms also have received a nice update and they feel much larger than they are. Additionally the staff were generally very professional and upbeat. I decided to take the girlfriend to Vegas for a 3 night stay. I also wanted to set up a big surprise for my girlfriend which took some planning and help from the concierge and thanks to said concierge it went off without a hitch. Thank you Concierge Guy whose name I forgotAgain. I hate to leave a bad review especially for a place that has the potential that the SLS has but here goes. I will state upfront so as to avoid the appearance of being unfair. After the problems we experienced our Resort Fees were comped and we received a 50 FB credit which paid for one round of beers for me my girlfriend and our two friends at the Bier Garten. it is worth mentioning that the 30 per night resort fees which cover complimentary fitness center access local and toll free phone calls access to the pools and in room Internet access were 95 unused by anyone in our group. My girlfriend and my friends wife hung out by the pool for a few hours and I used about an hours worth of internet access. The problem started when we arrived back to the room very late our first night after being away for several hours. When we opened the door an incredibly unpleasant odor greeted us. If you have ever experienced the odor that occurs when plumbing is not vented correctly then you know what I am talking about. a raw sewage smell. I immediately called guest services to report the problem and was told someone would be by the room the next day which was fine by me. it was late. He suggested noon since I was calling at 3 AM which would allow us to sleep in. We left the room about 1030 that morning and were away until very late again. As soon as we walked in the room the smell had changed from extremely unpleasant to almost overwhelming. Obviously nobody had been sent contrary to our agreement to address the problem. I called guest services again and spoke with the same guy from the previous night morning. He remembered speaking with me apologized and told me someone would be by the next day about the same time nonThe next day after being away from late morning until early evening we arrived back to the room who is odor had gone from almost overwhelming to almost unbearable. Again nobody had been in the room to address the issue. I called guest services again and they finally sent someone to the room. The guy they sent was great like most of the staff but was unable to solve the problem. Instead he sprayed some deodorizer in the A C return which seemed to immediately help. It was a nice fresh smell. After leaving that evening for dinner and arriving back we realized that the deodorizer had simply combined with the sewage smell instead of eliminating it. At least the odor was new I suppose. I can only assume that the cause of the horrid smell may have been the cause of me and the girlfriend waking up each morning with extreme sinus congestion and sore throats which abated shortly after we left the room each day. I can guarantee that the smell was the cause of the need to launder every stitch of clothing we had taken even the clean unused stuff upon returning home and febrezing the heck out of our luggage. Also our friends across the hall began to experience the same odor in their room but only after the 2nd night and not as overwhelming as our room. All in all I could not recommend the SLS in its current state. I have to assume that not all rooms have this problem but since it happened in our room and a room across the hall I also have to assume that this is a known issue. But for the one and wholly undeniable issue the place is great. The problem is that the SLS is a hotel. Hotel rooms should be habitable. We enjoyed our time at the bar and casino but we paid for that except for one round of beers. The room probably should have been entirely comped but instead at check out I had to convince the lady at the front desk that I was supposed to be comped the resort fees for all 3 nights because her notes only showed comped for 2A swing and a miss for the SLS. it is a shame because I really wanted to be able to rave about this place. We will return to Vegas. We will not return to the SLS.

Wonderful Hotel and Casino for couples. We just got back from Las Vegas and stayed at the SLS which we know nothing about however it was remodeled and very very nicely done. We got a king size bed and our room was very modern in style it was updated which included a state of the art bathroom which included a rain shower. I sleep better there than at home the bedding and pillows were to die for we loved the room and bathroom. It did not include a coffee pot or frig.

Great place to stay on the strip. Overall a pretty nice hotel that has been recently remodeled. The rooms are spacious with nice views on the upper floors. However beware of the resort fees. They charge 30 per day on top of the normal room prices. When we were there the pools were closed for the season and we were still charged them. When I asked they said they could be waived because they were mandatory. So guests are basically paying 30 a day for free wifi.
Very clean and updated game room.

Location and quality on par with price. Let me start by saying if this Hotel was located anywhere else in the US it would get a better rating. But for Las Vegas it ’s just average and that may be a little generous. There are so many incredible properties on the strip and this place is just a spot below. I was in Las Vegas this week to meet clients for business meetings. They booked for us to stay here. I ’ve seen several reviews that were not very complimentary of the staff and rooms. I did n’t find that at all this past week. Everyone was very friendly and the room was fine. The location is n’t very good as it ’s isolated from the new part of the strip and downtown Las Vegas. This is the old Sahara Hotel and they ’ve done the best they can in updating it. I have to finish with this for the price it is a really really good deal. It is absolutely worth the price we paid. I rated it only average however based on location the casino and the simple fact that it ’s just not up to the standard of the properties all around it. If this hotel was in any other town it would likely get rated higher. However it ’s Vegas so its average at best. Need something inexpensive though. This is a good buy.
What a mess. in remodeling of new owner. small casino dark sketxhy.

Poor service and unfair charges. The hotel is recent renovated. Everything is new. It is located at the far end of the strip It ’s a modern hotel but not a fancy one. The installations are good. You can find there all the services you need. It has several good restaurants casino bars and very pleasant atmosphere. Rooms are small and comfortable. Nothing fancy. Very basic European styleWindows are small with no view. There is no closet in the rooms. There is also no coffee machine in the rooms. The rooms where not so clean. We had to reclaim on several occasions. The prices in the restaurants are very expensive. Between 56 usd for a cofeThe WiFi was a disasterIt was very slow and disconnected a lot. The hotel is charging an extra fee 356 tax for each night for using its installations Swimming pool WiFi and GymIf I pay for a room why should I pay an extra fee for using the hotel instalationsIt should be included as in any other hotel in the world. The WiFi was bad and who can use the swimming pool in December when it ’s so coldThis hotel charge unfair tarifsPlease take it into consideration beforehand and not when you do checkout.

Good. Beautiful room and very updated loved loved loved the mirrors and the bed was comfortableI did not like that my room was a little dirty when I first walked in and I asked for clean sheets but was given a slightly stained comforter. Couch had some stains on it so I did n’t want to sit or put anything on it.
Pleasant. Comfortable beds and clean romConstruction and noise that was n’t mentioned anywhere. They are doing major renovations they should tell their guest.

My stay was during the remodel change from SLS back to Sahara. Lots of noise in the morning and scaffolds in the lobby area leading to my room. I sneezed a lot as something in the dusty hallways that lead to the elevators had me sneezing as soon as I entered. Otherwise my stay was okay.

Although the property is currently under renovation the suite i stayed in was finished. It was very nice looking at first appearance but it seems like they put all the money only in to appearance and not into functionality. No fridge to keep refreshments cold or possible left overs in the only fridge was the bar which had all the drinks but not a single snack that was listed. The water pressure in the shower was literally only a trickle extra large shower for 2 but unles you stood directly under the shower head and let the water trickle on to you you would not get wet. Hard to have a romantic 2 person shower when you have to play rock paper scissors to see who s going to get the next 5 minutes worth of the trickling water. Bed was very comfortable and we had an excellent view but overall felt very cheated with the overall quality. This room was all about appearance and very little about functionality. It was not as it was presented when the reservations were made.

Over all is a perfect place to stay with a reasonable price that everybody can afford to stay. the resort fee is mandatory but unreasonable charges way too high Not fair for those customers do not use the facility much. Like swimming pools and other. surrounding not bad but sometimes can see street people wondering around asking for money walking distance to some souvenirs shop and fast food restaurants easy access to airport and downtown by public transportation you have to pass by the renovation construction before get into your rom hotel provides 2 small bottles of waterEvery day.
Undergoing renovation when I went there.

Fun birthday stay. My husband and I stayed at the SAHARA to celebrate my 50th birthday. Even though the hotel is undergoing renovations we loved the hotel. The room was nice and roomy. The decor is modern. The staff is friendly. We loved that it is a stop on the monorail which makes it very convenient. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
in the process of a much needed total remodel the hotel is starting to look great. My room looked great and was very clean and quiet.

Very Good. The bed was SO comfortable. Access to the monorail is a plusProperty is still going through renovation. The casino is relatively small compared to others on the Strip. Area around the property can be a little sketchy at night.

great stay. Check in was a bit chaotic as they were in the middle of renovations and moving the check in area. The hotel is beautiful with the renovations that they are making. Our room was very quiet modern clean and fresh. One negative was not having a coffee maker in my room there was a Starbucks downstairs in the lobby but I had to go downstairs whenever I wanted one and wait in line which was sometimes long. Alcohol is an option in the room but I do not drink. My husband enjoyed the casino area small but nice the dealers were very friendly and hospitable. The tram is located at the back of this hotel which was a bonus also the bus to Fremont Street was just across the street and the bus for the strip was across the street as well. great location for getting around.

Hidden fees booking through Expedia always under renovations lobby noisy and smelling of burnt metal pool has not been open for two years poor restaurant offerings and the very end of the seedy end of the strip not worth the money.

Remodeled buy lacking. The pros nicely remodeled casino. More tables added. Very attentive beverage hostesesThe cons very average slot selection. It appears they took out a restaurant or two to make way for the extra tables. did not offer much incentive for us to stay and play.
Overall it was a great property loved the room decor. Only thing was that the pool area was down for remodeling.
Overpriced for what you get. Several maintenance problems in the room. I had to ask for the room to be cleaned.

I did n’t like that your in the check in office and they tell you if you want to upgrade your room. They tell you is a better room and it ’s renovated so we said yes. We got to the room and the room es nice but it was equipped like for a handicap person. really all the restroom with poles al over I did n’t like it for the price we had to pay.

Customer Service Was Appreciated. I recently stayed at the Sahara for the first time for a business trip. My room was on the end of hallway and quiet. I liked using my room key to work the elevator. I also liked that my elevator was close to the self parking garage. It was always an easy transition. Parking is free like it should be. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. I skipped daily cleaning and was given a few extra towels when I asked. The Fridge has a small freezer section big enough for an ice pack. Ice is available on another floor. You need the upgrade to get coffee in the room so I went with cold coffee in a bottle. The pools all three were closed for renovation. As a swimmer this could have been killer but I was busy with other things. It was my fault for not clearing the situation ahead of time. I expect the finished product will be nice. What set the Sahara apart for me was the customer service. My business partner and I needed some immediate help having missed the closure of the FedEx Ship Center. it is an unmanned center I believe. We had urgent correspondence that needed to go out tonight. it is our fault that we waited. Symone was not only friendly but helpful. She showed a great deal of patience as she cheerfully helped us with scanning and transmitting a document. I loved that we chatted while she was willing to repeat the process or try again or whatever was necessary. I actually had a very stressful day waiting to hear from my godson who lives in Nashville because of the tornados. I do n’t need to share details. Having to get this correspondence out tonight could have been another real stressor. I credit Symone with me helping to finish the day well. I did not mention my personal issues but I do not think it would have mattered. I expect she is the same with everyone. She is effervescent and would be a credit to ANY customer service team. So in the end it was a good stay. I heard from my godson and got an important document to its destination. The great customer service almost makes up for the pool refurbishment that I did not know about till I got here. Actually my fault for not checking In closing we enjoyed our experience at the Sahara. Symone was simply icing on the cake.
Refurbishment on goingHotel closed after 4 days told to leave immediately with no warning due to shut down. Had to drive to LA to find accommodation with no notice.
Currently under renovation A little off the strip. Great service.
